title: Ableton Live 9 Suite v9.0.6 x64bit AIO Installer
description:
Ableton Live 9 Suite v9.0.6 x64bit AIO Installer - -nelly-
             ==========================================================



               N.B.: THIS INSTALLER MUST BE RAN AS ADMINISTRATOR
               =================================================


Ableton Live Suite v9.0.6 x64bit - this updated software for musicians and DJs, allowing you to create music, perform live , to make installation, a new library with the beautiful sounds and other useful resources. Ableton Suite contains 10 instruments from Ableton, including synths, a sampler, electric and acoustic drums, as well as numerous sampled instruments.


Improvements and feature changes:
=================================

Added control surface support for Novation Launch Control.
Added control surface support for Novation Launchkey Mini.
Added control surface support for Reloop KeyFadr.
Added control surface support for Reloop KeyPad.
Updated lessons.



System requirements : 
=====================

-Intel / Mac with Mac OS X 10.5 or later.
-Multicore processor.
-2 GB RAM.
-1024x768 display.
-DVD- drive and broadband internet for the installation.
-Required disk space : 3GB.
-55 GB free disk space needed to install all sounds.

Product INFO:
=============

Year: 2013.
Version: v9.0.6 x64bit.
Developer : Ableton.

For anyone WHO MAY HAVE issues with installation, extraction, wrong file extensions, passwords etc for this or any of my other installer torrents. Go to:

Start-Computer-Documents-Organize-Folder and search options-View

Then from the scroll menu that appears, un-tick the option of "Hide extensions for known file types". Click on "Apply" and then click on "OK" (Screen shot below):

http://i.imgur.com/5rFrOno.jpg" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://i.imgur.com/5rFrOno.jpg</a>

Once you've done that. Return to your downloaded installer torrent of mine and change the file extension to .exe

Then right click on it and select "Run as administrator". 

NONE of my torrents are, or ever have been passworded or have any other type of security, re-directs etc on them.
